  16. (* Internals of forcing lazy values. *)

  18. ‌type 'a t = 'a lazy_t

  20. exception Undefined

  22. (* [update_to_forcing blk] tries to update a [blk] with [lazy_tag] to
  23.    [forcing_tag] using compare-and-swap (CAS), taking care to handle concurrent
  24.    marking of the header word by a concurrent GC thread. Returns [0] if the
  25.    CAS is successful. If the CAS fails, then the tag was observed to be
  26.    something other than [lazy_tag] due to a concurrent mutator. In this case,
  27.    the function returns [1]. *)
  28. external update_to_forcing : Obj.t -> int =
  29.   "caml_lazy_update_to_forcing" [@@noalloc]

  31. (* [reset_to_lazy blk] expects [blk] to be a lazy object with [Obj.forcing_tag]
  32.    and updates the tag to [Obj.lazy_tag], taking care to handle concurrent
  33.    marking of this object's header by a concurrent GC thread. *)
  34. external reset_to_lazy : Obj.t -> unit = "caml_lazy_reset_to_lazy" [@@noalloc]

  36. (* [update_to_forward blk] expects [blk] to be a lazy object with
  37.    [Obj.forcing_tag] and updates the tag to [Obj.forward_tag], taking care to
  38.    handle concurrent marking of this object's header by a concurrent GC thread.
  39. *)
  40. external update_to_forward : Obj.t -> unit =
  41.   "caml_lazy_update_to_forward" [@@noalloc]

  43. (* Assumes [blk] is a block with tag forcing *)
  44. ‌let do_force_block blk =
  45.   let b = Obj.repr blk in
  46.   let closure = (Obj.obj (Obj.field b 0) : unit -> 'arg) in
  47.   Obj.set_field b 0 (Obj.repr ()); (* Release the closure *)
  48.   try
  49.     let result = closure () in
  50.     Obj.set_field b 0 (Obj.repr result);
  51.     update_to_forward b;
  52.     result
  53.   with e ->
  54.     Obj.set_field b 0 (Obj.repr (fun () -> raise e));
  55.     reset_to_lazy b;
  56.     raise e

  58. (* Assumes [blk] is a block with tag forcing *)
  59. let do_force_val_block blk =
  60.   let b = Obj.repr blk in
  61. ‌  let closure = (Obj.obj (Obj.field b 0) : unit -> 'arg) in
  62.   Obj.set_field b 0 (Obj.repr ()); (* Release the closure *)
  63. ‌  let result = closure () in
  64.   Obj.set_field b 0 (Obj.repr result);
  65.   update_to_forward b;
  66.   result

  68. (* Called by [force_gen] *)
  69. ‌let force_gen_lazy_block ~only_val (blk : 'arg lazy_t) =
  70.   (* We expect the tag to be [lazy_tag], but may be other tags due to
  71.      concurrent forcing of lazy values. *)
  72.   match update_to_forcing (Obj.repr blk) with
  73.   | 0 when only_val -> do_force_val_block blk
  74.   | 0 -> do_force_block blk
  75.   | _ -> raise Undefined

  77. (* used in the %lazy_force primitive *)
  78. ‌let force_lazy_block blk = force_gen_lazy_block ~only_val:false blk

  80. (* [force_gen ~only_val:false] is not used, since [Lazy.force] is
  81.    declared as a primitive whose code inlines the tag tests of its
  82.    argument, except when afl instrumentation is turned on. *)
  83. ‌let force_gen ~only_val (lzv : 'arg lazy_t) =
  84.   (* Using [Sys.opaque_identity] prevents two potential problems:
  85.      - If the value is known to have Forward_tag, then it could have been
  86.        shortcut during GC, so that information must be forgotten (see GPR#713
  87.        and issue #7301). This is not an issue here at the moment since
  88.        [Obj.tag] is not simplified by the compiler, and GPR#713 also
  89.        ensures that no value will be known to have Forward_tag.
  90.      - If the value is known to be immutable, then if the compiler
  91.        cannot prove that the last branch is not taken it will issue a
  92.        warning 59 (modification of an immutable value) *)
  93.   let lzv = Sys.opaque_identity lzv in
  94.   let x = Obj.repr lzv in
  95.   (* START no safe points. If a GC occurs here, then the object [x] may be
  96.      short-circuited, and getting the first field of [x] would get us the wrong
  97.      value. Luckily, the compiler does not insert GC safe points at this place,
  98.      so it is ok. *)
  99.   let t = Obj.tag x in
  100.   if t = Obj.forward_tag then
  101.     (Obj.obj (Obj.field x 0) : 'arg)
  102.   (* END no safe points *)
  103.   else if t = Obj.forcing_tag then raise Undefined
  104.   else if t <> Obj.lazy_tag then (Obj.obj x : 'arg)
  105.   else force_gen_lazy_block ~only_val lzv
